image.altText: Anthony Nocera arms crossed against a dark background on location at State Theatre South Australia

props.synopsis: An upcoming South Australian playwright was writing a horror, comedy show about the prospect of losing a much older partner, then it happened to him.

title.children: Rising SA playwright's late fiance 'lives on' in emotional theatre debut

image.altText: A professional portrait of Tim who is wearing a suit jacket and business shirt

props.synopsis: Tim Picton, who spearheaded the campaign behind WA Labor's landslide 2021 victory, is in a critical condition in hospital after he was allegedly assaulted in Northbridge.

title.children: Labor party identity fighting for life after alleged assault in Perth

image.altText: A man holding a cricket shirt in front of a beach.

props.synopsis: They travelled on horse and cart and were smuggled on a boat for three months to England, the story of the First XI Aboriginal cricket team is being remembered as a descendant presents the Boxing Day medal.

title.children: 'They were a band of brothers': The largely untold story of Australia's first touring cricket team

image.altText: A man, woman and two teenage girls smiling at the camera. There is a river behind them.

props.synopsis: History is being brought back to life at a former pastoral station that has seen drought, boom and bust over the course of its 175 years.

title.children: Historic riverside Nor' West Bend open to public after decades of restoration

image.altText: Dairy cows stand behind a fence.

props.synopsis: New technology allowing livestock to be remotely moved via electronic collars has been legalised in SA. Industry says virtual fencing has the potential to save animals and even human lives.

title.children: Emerging virtual fencing tech could help save cattle trapped in bushfires

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking in an interview in a concerned manner

props.synopsis: Nick Bolkus, the long-time Labor senator who played an influential role in shaping Australia's migration policy under prime minister Paul Keating, has died aged 75.

title.children: SA Labor stalwart and former federal minister Nick Bolkus dies

image.altText: Peter Drew pastes up a poster

props.synopsis: An Adelaide street artist's poster aimed at provoking thought about national identity has been vandalised with racist graffiti.

title.children: 'Aussie' poster in Adelaide vandalised with 'white power' graffiti

image.altText: A blonde woman in a black T-shirt with a cliff and ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: For decades, pregnancy was seen as an "injury" that could end a career. But now, determination and growing industry support are seeing marathon-running mothers reach new heights after giving birth.

title.children: The women competing in marathons and breaking records after giving birth

image.altText: A young Kamahl fronting his television show with the ABC orchestra

props.synopsis: At 91, Malaysian-born Australian entertainment legend Kamahl reflects on his life and career.

title.children: Kamahl reflects on his life and career as he finishes likely final recording

image.altText: Woman wearing colouful top and apron stands smiling in her kitchen with cakes wrapped in colourful paper on bench next to her

props.synopsis: As households across the world sit down to enjoy a festive feast, Faye Taylor revels in knowing 500 of her traditional Christmas cakes are bringing enjoyment and helping raise funds for people in need.

title.children: Faye's great Christmas cake baking mission

image.altText: A Santa Claus sitting on a throne surrounded by presents at kids festival

props.synopsis: South Australia's Christmas traditions have evolved from the days of John Martin's Magic Cave. So, can the state lay claim to being the most festive in Australia?

title.children: Is South Australia the most festive state?

image.altText: A woman and a black labrador dog stand in front of a vast outback landscape

props.synopsis: Moolooloo station, nestled in South Australia's Flinders Ranges, might look like your typical outback farm, but the workforce at this station has one unique addition — a black labrador called Mika.

title.children: Seeing eye dog Mika is helping station owner navigate life on the land

image.altText: A women holds up four different types of frozen prawns in bags

props.synopsis: New research shows younger Aussies prefer to save time and mess by buying pre-peeled prawns over the festive season.

title.children: Peeled or whole? How we buy prawns reveals a growing generational divide

image.altText: A woman with a serious expression and black hair takes a selfie

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman accused of repeatedly encouraging her partner to take his own life has been granted home detention bail.

title.children: Woman accused of 'repeatedly encouraging' partner to suicide granted bail

image.altText: A wind turbine in the foreground with others in the background among pine trees

props.synopsis: In a tiny town near the Victoria–South Australia border, a proposed wind farm near a protected wetland is posing a big question for Australia's planning regulators.

title.children: When green energy threatens what it is meant to save

image.altText: A smiling woman sitting at a desk.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of trying to murder her ex-husband before fleeing to Palau has made a bid in South Australia's Supreme Court for release on bail.

title.children: Woman accused of trying to kill ex allegedly searched for 'hit men'

image.altText: An opened box of silver tube-like detonators on top of a red file on the table

props.synopsis: A man has been charged after police allegedly seized explosive detonators and three unregistered firearms among other weapons from his property in Adelaide's north.

title.children: Weapons, detonators allegedly found in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A man with voluminous hair and a black jacket plucks the strings of a black electric guitar on a stage

props.synopsis: The Cure guitarist and keyboard player Perry Bamonte has died aged 65, the legendary British dark rock band announced on Friday.

title.children: The Cure guitarist and keyboard player Perry Bamonte dies aged 65

image.altText: Man smiling wearing white helmet and a green and yellow jersey, at an ice rink

props.synopsis: North Queenslanders have been playing the ice-based sport broomball for decades, but dwindling numbers and rising costs have players fearing it may be dying.

title.children: It's a scorcher outside in North Queensland — perfect for broomball

image.altText: A woman in a black shirt sitting on a chair outside.

props.synopsis: Lucinda is a member of an exclusive club — living heart donors, and is the only woman to have a baby after a heart-lung-liver transplant

title.children: Lucinda donated her heart to another woman 20 years ago. She's still alive to tell the tale

image.altText: Close up of ladybugs

props.synopsis: When politicians and most staff are away for the summer holidays, a ravenous group of fly-in workers descend on Parliament House.

title.children: 'Voracious feeders' set loose at Parliament House to take out pests

image.altText: Two police officers arrest a man, who has his head covered.

props.synopsis: A man is arrested following a Melbourne crime spree that allegedly began about 7pm on Christmas Day and ended with burglaries of two restaurants about 6:30am on Boxing Day.

title.children: Man charged with string of offences after burglaries on Christmas Day

image.altText: An aerial shot of a puff of smoke.

props.synopsis: The ceasefire will take effect on Saturday at noon local time, in a conflict which has displaced more than half a million people on both sides.

title.children: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire, ending weeks of clashes

image.altText: A woman wearing Somaliland colours.

props.synopsis: Matters of strategy are behind Israel's drive to recognise Somaliland, analysts say, as Arab nations worry about instability in the region.

title.children: Somalia, Arab nations denounce Israeli recognition of Somaliland

image.altText: A side profile of Kelvin who wears a hat and fire gear

props.synopsis: Volunteer firefighters put their lives on the line for their community, despite facing extreme situations, heightened health risks and constant exposure to traumatic events.

title.children: 'My second family': The volunteers risking their lives to keep us safe

image.altText: A open room with large windows and furniture all over the carpet floor after an explosion.

props.synopsis: The attack has been claimed by the ultra-conservative Sunni group Saraya Ansar al-Sunnah, which was also responsible for a Damascus church bombing in June.

title.children: Mosque blast during Friday prayers kills eight in Syria

image.altText: Myanmar politician Ko Ko Gyi stands at a lectern dressed in yellow

props.synopsis: Five years after the military toppled a democratically elected government and imprisoned its leaders, the country is preparing to hold national elections beginning on December 28.

title.children: Myanmar's first election in five years begins – but experts warn it's a sham

image.altText: A crowd of men look at a missile during an Aerospace & Defense Technology Exhibition.

props.synopsis: China urged the US to "stop the dangerous moves of arming Taiwan" after its multi-billion-dollar sale of weapons last week.

title.children: China sanctions US defence firms over arms sales to Taiwan

image.altText: A professional portrait of Tim who is wearing a suit jacket and business shirt

props.synopsis: Tim Picton, who spearheaded the campaign behind WA Labor's landslide 2021 victory, is in a critical condition in hospital after he was allegedly assaulted in Northbridge.

title.children: Labor party identity fighting for life after alleged assault in Perth

image.altText: An Australian women's tennis player pumps her fist in celebration during a match.

props.synopsis: Popular Australian Storm Hunter is back from injury and adamant she can return to the form that made her the world's top-ranked doubles player.

title.children: Storm warning: Aussie wants to regain world number one status

image.altText: A single jet flying in the sky, pictured from a level altitude.

props.synopsis: Poland has warned several incidents regarding airspace during the holiday season may signal a provocation.

title.children: Poland intercepts Russian plane, reports airspace breaches from Belarus

image.altText: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy with his hand on his chest talks to journalists

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he is planning to meet with US President Donald Trump on Sunday to search for ways to end the war with Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy says he plans to meet with Trump on Sunday

image.altText: A man in a grey jacket and white collared shirt smiles in front of a crowd dressed in blue shirts that say "Tim Wilson".

props.synopsis: In a broad ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, Liberal MP Tim Wilson speaks about what the Liberal Party should be fighting for and why he would one day like to be its leader.

title.children: Tim Wilson believes 'most' Liberal MPs would be untroubled by gay leader

image.altText: A red haze of smoke and fire in the background of a paddock.

props.synopsis: The bushfire has burnt through more than 4,000 hectares.

title.children: Boddington gold mine damaged by fire burning south-east of Perth

image.altText: Hazel in cricket uniform smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: There was no central catalogue for the scattered histories of women's cricket. That may be about to change.

title.children: Family unearths story of Australian cricket's 'girl Bradman' Hazel Pritchard
